titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the Brochsteins Inc. Corporate Records MS 717

publicationstmt.publisher: Woodson Research Center, Rice University, Houston, Texas

note.p: Boxes stored off-site at the Library Service Center. Please request this material via woodson@rice.edu or call 713-348-2586. Architectural drawings in map case drawers 198-212.

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on 2022-04-02 00:00:48 -0500.

did.head: Collection Summary

repository.corpname: Woodson Research Center, Rice University, Houston, Texas

did.abstract: Brochsteins Inc. corporate records contains architectural drawings, images, and business records from 1935-2000.

bioghist.head: Historical Note
bioghist.p: Brochsteins, Inc. of Houston has been a manufacturer of fine architectural woodwork and custom furniture since 1935. The company has provided widely diverse architecturally designed fixtures, such as paneling, doors, trim, desks, workstations and conference tables for financial institutions, law and corporate offices, public buildings, retail-commercial projects, as well as museums and residences. Each project is uniquely produced for each client, constructed according to the specifications of the architects and designers and coordinated according to the requirements of the contrator. Brochsteins develops detail drawings, mock-ups and prototypes, and provides assistance in the selection of woods for any project.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Brochsteins Inc. corporate records contains architectural drawings, images, and business records from 1935-2000.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: This material is open for research.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: Stored off-site at the Library Service Center. Please request this material via woodson@rice.edu or call 713-348-2586.

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition
acqinfo.p: Collection was donated by Deborah Brochstein, Brochsteins Inc. on Oct. 10, 2017.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: Collection is arranged in three series: Series I Architectural drawings; Series II Images, Series III Business files, with subseries as necessary.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Brochsteins Inc. Corporate Records, MS 717, Woodson Research Center, Fondren Library, Rice University

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: Permission to publish from Brochsteins Inc. Corporate Records must be obtained from Woodson Research Center, Fondren Library, Rice University.
